description: From Middle English verveyne, from Old French verveine, from Latin verbÄ“na. Doublet of verbena.

entries.meaning: Any herbaceous plant in the genus Verbena especially if used for medicinal purposes, primarily Verbena officinalis, common in Europe and formerly held to have medicinal properties.
